A hands-on guide to grasping the moon's schedule for this special day, honored on October 20, 2024.

The moon on Karwa Chauth often graces the sky later in the evening, a result of its natural orbit. This timing aligns with the celestial dance of its position and Earth's location, creating a beautiful cosmic harmony.
Karwa Chauth occurs on the fourth day (Chaturthi) of the moon's waning phase (Krishna Paksha). As it's just four days after the full moon, the moon rises later in the evening.
The moon rises about 50 minutes later daily, so by the fourth waning night, moonrise shifts much later than it was on the full moon.
Your exact spot on Earth—latitude and longitude—sets when the moon rises, causing times to vary between cities.
